techmeme.title: Google buys NYC-based cybersecurity company Wiz for $32B, its largest-ever acquisition, subject to approval; a $23B deal collapsed in 2024 over antitrust fears (The Verge)
Solana deleted a social media ad for its conference in May 2025 after the crypto community criticized it for insensitivity towards gender issues (Timmy Shen/The Block)
Tencent releases five AI tools to turn text or images into 3D visuals and graphics, based on Hunyuan3D-2.0, and plans to integrate DeepSeek's R1 into WeChat (Bloomberg)
Sources: Alphabet has agreed to acquire cybersecurity startup Wiz for $32B+ and will announce the deal today, after talks over a $23B deal collapsed in 2024 (Financial Times)
Since Xi Jinping met DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng last month, Chinese officials are rushing to use the AI model, including in courthouses and in hospitals (New York Times)
